pullRequest.body:
---

discovered while investigating slowdowns in #16975, see [Zulip](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/287929-mathlib4/topic/performance.20issues.20with.20.60SubringClass.60.2E/near/472715436)

<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

### PR summary [b0b2d655af](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/17395/commits/b0b2d655af3f8060ed892e02c67284dafe68158f)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

No declarations were harmed in the making of this PR! üêô
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.
!bench

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/2e58e918-8189-4fb3-9a6d-7ece6cd8d361) for commit 2fadde607240120368ec78597a9d1c2afb5c6c42.
There were [significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/044008b2-78b4-4692-a6fa-d3b876a8181a/to/2e58e918-8189-4fb3-9a6d-7ece6cd8d361) against commit 1c37f1e9241238bc538b1e4c3921d117f650894b:
```diff
  Benchmark                                         Metric         Change
  =======================================================================
+ ~Mathlib.NumberTheory.Cyclotomic.PrimitiveRoots   instructions   -21.1%
+ ~Mathlib.NumberTheory.NumberField.Discriminant    instructions   -12.0%
```
üöÄ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by Ruben-VandeVelde.

:v: j-loreaux can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11219579360/job/31185845833)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11219579360/job/31185846500)
bors d+
maintainer merge
Impressive!
maintainer merge
bors d+
Omega is better anyway if it works, so I'd remove the note
I don't think you need the semicolon

If you keep this comment:
```suggestion
-- Porting note: the following `have` were not needed because the locale `cyclotomic` set them
```
Maybe add a note here and below that this should be purely an optimization?
While you're here, the suffices seems pretty redundant when you could just `rw` with the `have` you prove inside it

```suggestion
  -- this is purely an optimization
  letI pb := Algebra.adjoin.powerBasis <| (integral {n} K L).isIntegral Œ∂
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - perf(NumberTheory): speed up some slow declarations
